CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1966, pg. 1A, reads: "The Mighty Seven - Shown above the seven players who carried Schenley High School to the state high school basketball championship of Pennsylvania at the Civic Arena last Saturday night. From left are Jake Williams, Jim Prince, Charley Burley, Kenny Durrett, Montell Brundage, Marv Snowden and Ed Gibson.  The 74-64 triumph against Chester made Schenley the first City League team to win the state title since 1937...Harris Photo."Cutline of image published after event in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1980, pg. 10, reads: "The Way Things Were...back in 1966 after the Schenley High Spartans captured the state basketball championship.  Along with Ken Durrett (holding trophy) are (l-r) teammates Jake Williams, Jim Prince, Charley Burley, Durrett, Montell Brundage, Marv Snowden and Ed (Pete) Gibson.  This 'magnificent seven' gave the City League their first state toga since 1937. (Harris Photo).
TitMainTitle: City League champion Schenley High School basketball team, from left: #52 Jake Williams holding net, #42 Jim Prince, #30 Charley Burley Jr., #54 Kenny Durrett holding trophy, #32 Montell Brundage, #24 Marvin "Marv" Snowden, and #50 Ed (Pete) Gibson holding medals, posed in hallway of Civic Arena
